name.description: Specifies the name of the Data Factory. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Must be globally unique. See the [Microsoft documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-factory/naming-rules

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the Data Factory.

location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

branch_name.description: Specifies the branch of the repository to get code from.

git_url.description: Specifies the GitHub Enterprise host name. For example: https://github.mydomain.com. Use https://github.com for open source repositories.

repository_name.description: Specifies the name of the git repository.

root_folder.description: Specifies the root folder within the repository. Set to `/` for the top level.

type.description: Specifies the identity type of the Data Factory. At this time the only allowed value is `SystemAssigned`.

project_name.description: Specifies the name of the VSTS project.

tenant_id.description: Specifies the Tenant ID associated with the VSTS account.

id.description: The ID of the Data Factory.

principal_id.description: The ID of the Principal (Client) in Azure Active Directory

tenant_id.description: The ID of the Azure Active Directory Tenant.

create.description: Used when creating the Data Factory.

update.description: Used when updating the Data Factory.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Data Factory.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Data Factory.
